str2: Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be in trouble, doubt, difficulty; To be at a loss. From dia and aporeo; to be thoroughly nonplussed.

parse: Verb - Present Optative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A spectacle, vision, that which is seen. From horao; something gazed at, i.e. A spectacle.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
Cornelius, a centurion of the Roman army, stationed at Caesarea. Of Latin origin; Cornelius, a Roman.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To find by inquiry. From dia and erotao; to question throughout, i.e. Ascertain by interrogation.
Simon. Of Hebrew origin; Simon, the name of nine Israelites.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To stand by, be urgent, befall one (as of evil), be at hand, impend. From epi and histemi; to stand upon, i.e. Be present.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From pule; a gate-way, door-way of a building or city; by implication, a portal or vestibule.
